verses.verse: (Hos. 10:9) They are deeply corrupted, As in the days of (Judg. 19:22) Gibeah. He will remember their iniquity; He will punish their sins.

“I found Israel Like grapes in the (Jer. 2:2) wilderness; I saw your fathers As the (Is. 28:4; Mic. 7:1) firstfruits on the fig tree in its first season. But they went to (Num. 25:3; Ps. 106:28) Baal Peor, And separated themselves to that shame; (Ps. 81:12) They became an abomination like the thing they loved.
As for Ephraim, their glory shall fly away like a bird— No birth, no pregnancy, and no conception!
Though they bring up their children, Yet I will bereave them to the last man. Yes, (Deut. 31:17; Hos. 7:13) woe to them when I depart from them!
Just (Ezek. 26—28) as I saw Ephraim like Tyre, planted in a pleasant place, So Ephraim will bring out his children to the murderer.”
Give them, O LORD— What will You give? Give them (Luke 23:29) a miscarrying womb And dry breasts!

“All their wickedness is in (Hos. 4:15; 12:11) Gilgal, For there I hated them. Because of the evil of their deeds I will drive them from My house; I will love them no more. (Is. 1:23; Hos. 5:2) All their princes are rebellious.
Ephraim is (Hos. 5:11) stricken, Their root is dried up; They shall bear no fruit. Yes, were they to bear children, I would kill the darlings of their womb.”
My God will (2 Kin. 17:20; (Zech. 10:6)) cast them away, Because they did not obey Him; And they shall be (Lev. 26:33) wanderers among the nations.

Israel’s Sin and Captivity Israel (Nah. 2:2) empties his vine; He brings forth fruit for himself. According to the multitude of his fruit (Jer. 2:28; Hos. 8:11; 12:11) He has increased the altars; According to the bounty of his land They have embellished his sacred pillars.
Their heart is (1 Kin. 18:21; Zeph. 1:5; (Matt. 6:24)) divided; Now they are held guilty. He will break down their altars; He will ruin their sacred pillars.
For now they say, “We have no king, Because we did not fear the LORD. And as for a king, what would he do for us?”
They have spoken words, Swearing falsely in making a covenant. Thus judgment springs up (Deut. 31:16, 17; 2 Kin. 17:3, 4; Amos 5:7) like hemlock in the furrows of the field.

The inhabitants of Samaria fear Because of the (1 Kin. 12:28, 29; Hos. 8:5, 6; 13:2) calf of Beth Aven. For its people mourn for it, And its priests shriek for it— Because its (Hos. 9:11) glory has departed from it.
The idol also shall be carried to Assyria As a present for King (Hos. 5:13) Jareb. Ephraim shall receive shame, And Israel shall be ashamed of his own counsel.
